TextBlock.TextLine: In Antwerp en 20 Aprill
Brussel Seger vander Borght
Mons. desen tot covert vande facteur voor iul goedt, sijnde gepak
in een pack S.V.BB, de 13 laken s & 3 bayen dander 12 bayden sijn
op 4 vollen peroft ider rolle van 3 stucken, soo dat die voor een passeen
endevraght vant pack 8 st ul tol brief is noch goet, ick hebbe tot noch
toe geene accasie gevonden om op ul te treken waertoe soo de gelegen
thijt bekomen ul sal laten weten, soo ul peeter bernas kant te spreken
voor mijn vader hebt hem alleen te seggen dat hier Â£25 gereet is in cleijn
gelt laet hem daer self occasie toesoeken, al soo mijn vader aen hem hier
Antwarp 20 Aprill
& niet te brussel moet betaelen blijve
Brussel Joseph Sabberton
S. I had exspected you here before now, tis onely to desire you please to send
mee 3 or 4 peeces of truille worck of 8 elles a pr from 30 to 60 stivers an ele
assorted as you know will sell in England, pray send mee some pennij worth
Antwerpen 20 Aprill
or other & that pr first whist I remaine -
Brussel Bernaerd vanderklooster
Mons. nae dat heden aen ul mijne brief had versonden soo ontfangen den
ul van gisteren met eenen wissel brief van 500 patt. tot loste van Jan foane
Dongvers den selve brief sal aen ul morgen niet protest weeerom senden
alsoo den voors Donguers gesteren is gebroken oversulx niet geaccept
ofte betaelt sal worden soo gelieft ul daerinne niet te ingageeren ck
hebbe tot brussel wel soo deanigh somme waert saeck ul mij dat hier konde
doen ontfangen soude ul dat brussel doen tellen soo nae groett
In Antwerpen 21 Aprill 1681
Turnhout Peettr Vobert
mons. hebbe den ul van gisteren wel ontfangen, desen in antwoort
als dat de catoene lijnwaert noch niet sijn gekomen, maer soo haest
descuarriveeren sal ul een stuck toesenden, waer op ul moght verlaten
waer mede nae graet Blijve
Antwerpen Ar. 21 apli. 1681
Amtt mess. de Hulter & van Humrigh
In antwoort aen ul aeng. van 18 deser seynde ingeslooten te versoghte reeq van
verkoop oner de leste 60 vaten boter, de selve d'accord bevindende gelieft vervolgens
te notteeren, soo haest de 33 groote vaten 8 Jan Cornelisd arriveeren sal het noodige
daer voor besorgen, ende mijn best doen te verkoopen tot ul meestn anantaggie
wegens het gonde leer, en tapijten hebbe voor contf nidts connen bedingen, raeckende
de segrvians wolle waer van ul de monster hadde gesonden, de selve was verkoght
dogh daer is wat beekers a 31 Â¼ alsoo mijne partije weijnigh is, aende de prove geerne
in 't werck seude stellen, soo is mijn versoeck sonder tijt verlaes 2 baelen gelieft te doen
in coopen & op 't spoedightt mij toeseynden, daer in doende als voor eijgen waer
op mij verlaete
Antwerpen 21 apil
Brussel seger vanderborght
mons. gisteren hebbe aen ul de rek gesonden vant goet aen ul verkoght
heden occcasie bekomen hebbende, hebbe op ul getroken Æ 1200: te betalen
opsight p cassa aen d'ordre van mons. Joseph manuel Castilio spaiaert
hebbende de selve weirde alhier ontfangen ende op ul rek gestelt deere
van mijnen brief weert ul gerecommandeert waer in ul wijders
Antweopen 21 April
kandienen gelieft te commandeeren
Brussel Bernaerd randerklooster
monsr. volgens gisteren gen ul hebbe geschreven soo sende ul hier ingesloten
den wisselb van voo pat terugge feneffens protest d'welke costgs
die ul vanden vrint in voorderen & mij niet gelegentheyt groun
doen soo ul in gets anders kan dienen gelieft te commanderen
Brussel John Jacops
In Antwerpen 21 aprill 1681
monsr hebbe gisteren aen ul het noodigh geschreven, heden ben onversins is
belast geworden een groote pertij gelts te betalen soo dat bij nae al mijne
beste vrinden hebbe moet moeylijk vallen waer ondder ul mede hebbe de vrij
gheet heden genomen van op ul te treken Â£100: vlaems op drij a 4 da
light p cassa aend ordre van Joseph mannel castillio het welke versoek
niet qualijk nemt maer de goecheyt hebt den selve brieft te voldoen
en ul sall in alle accasie verobligeeren &
In Antwerpen 22 Aprill 1681
London Arthur Anneslay
th
S. my last to you was on the 19: curitt to which please to be referred sence
non from you, so this cheefly for covert to the in closed pattarnes accordingly
to which you please to ind order from mr. wood 3 bales besides one bale of clothe
serges & one with perpetuancos assorted as noted by the pattarnes I hem to
be schipped off att Exon for Brugges p the very first vessels that sailes
that way & to before our acctt. in comp. I referre to you the fuither
recommandation in ordering in. wood to privide good goods by advise of
mr. Southell he doth well, where fore i supose you will im ploy hims
whoever that is left to you, whilst now them I shall be gladd to heare from
you how fars he shall have advanced in the proiding of them, for most
all yd resting goods are sold & made good prid for them, so that Ihome
you will finde content, as soone what is gett resting is sold shall send
&aleare that acctt to be ginne the new on comp. haveing homore to in large
mr Anneslay you please to in order 3 bales each tto cont 3o serges 22 yd wi
to be assorted in cullours as these pattarnes N. 1â 2& 3 the firft I bale in prises
from 36 to 39 st apence the secondin prijses from 35 to40 st a 41 t a p
the 3: bale from 40 to 44 a 45 st apeeceen butt do not tye m. word abtohal
so much to the prijses as well to the cullours & good ness to
to cont i5 gold cullours ditto as N.3
one bale
ayard broad, or there about
20 p of the beste goods 22 yd and
in prijses as best they are to be had besides one bale to cont: is gold culloured
serges of 24 y as these pattarnes of N.2 good goods as best they are
to be hadd the se serges to be don up, as formerty he is used to do butt foulded
comer what norrower not hatt pressed butt cwold prest yett to be better prest
then formarly besides to provide one bale of white perpetuanios v
5 yallow lists of the best sort,
10 blew lists of 40
10 ditto of 44 a 46 st ap
3 Aprill 1681
London will scawen
S. miy last to you was on the 15th curitte sence reed both yd of 2 &8 ditto
bij which you mention that our goods intended by Adriaen Deraes who
I thuck was butt them come to london I are shipt aboard Antonij
derelaere & that you have send the bill of loading to mr. Coots I am sorr
they did not come with michiel de raes who hath been heere 4 a5 dag
ateles mee that he stayed one tyde longer att att granesande, thenon
had desired him to do & complaints of preiudce happined to him there
bij because had last room on his bourd to that purpose, I wonder wha
you de layd shipping so long after the vale of the comp. princippally
such goods as must not be dijed most our goods are sold hem and the
att the time that they are most demanded I have non
you draw Â£500: att 36:2 att 2 uso on mee yd bill I have accepted & past to
my acctt. according to yd. order though I shall be butt little indebted on
that acctts so that shall be due to mee on the same shall afterwards betransferred
to yd whilst I do exspect to heare from you what shall be past with the
rest of the goods & remaine with kinde salut
